title: looking for handwritten font
content:
a font that mimics the organic style of the farmers market labels  
such as in this image.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/23235986_6405.jpg)

 [‹ Logotypes](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44636 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font id ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44618 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jolene stark

comments.content:
Not sure there is anything that really makes a handwritten font ’farmers market’-centric.

I’d start here:

[http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=handwriting+&producttype...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=handwriting+&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2cRF "http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=handwriting+&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2cRF")

Hello:

Have a gander Xavier Dupre’s and Hubert Jocham work:

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_parango\_regular\_italic...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_parango_regular_italic/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_parango\_regular\_italic/")

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_tartine\_script\_pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_tartine_script_pro/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_tartine\_script\_pro/")

[http://www.hubertjocham.de/index.php/type/packaging/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.hubertjocham.de/index.php/type/packaging/ "http://www.hubertjocham.de/index.php/type/packaging/")

Mikey :-)

thanks for the suggestions; I might just have to get the sharpie out and start experimenting, ’cause nothing I have seen in my search has the right feel.  
I did find ClickArt® Fonts 3 Deluxe (sounds cheesy, I know) which has many options, however, it is for PC only. Does anyone know what this collection of handwritten fonts is and where to find something similar for Mac?

One of the nicest handwritten fonts I’ve seen of late is Nick Cookes - Olicana

[http://www.typophile.com/node/16296](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16296 "http://www.typophile.com/node/16296")

you can purchase it here:

[http://www.type.co.uk/index.php?p=a\_to\_z&search=olicana](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.type.co.uk/index.php?p=a_to_z&search=olicana "http://www.type.co.uk/index.php?p=a\_to\_z&search=olicana")

Olicana is nice. I think I am going w/ Chunder w/ a little customization, however, so that it is less thick.

[http://www.t26.com/search?q=chunder](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211832/http:/www.t26.com/search?q=chunder "http://www.t26.com/search?q=chunder")
jolene: OSX should be able to handle “PC” fonts just fine.
